title: 5 Simple Steps to Play the Zerg Rush Game on Google

steps.title: Go to https://www.google.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.google.com in a web browser. You can use Google Chrome , Safari, Mozilla Firefox , or another browser. If you're using a mobile browser, you may experience some bugs. For the best experience, use a desktop browser on a computer.

steps.title: Type zerg rush into the search field.
steps.content: Type zerg rush into the search field. Don't press Enterâ€”just type it for now. Make sure to avoid any typos.

steps.title: Click I'm Feeling Lucky.
steps.content: Click I'm Feeling Lucky . You will see this at the bottom of the search results. This will launch the top search on the results page, which is where you'll find the easter egg. Alternatively, you can click Google Search (desktop) or Go (mobile), and then select the first search result, which should be: https://elgoog.im/zergrush . [2] X Research source At first, you'll see what looks like a traditional Google search results page. After a few seconds, the game will begin.

steps.title: Click all the O's to destroy them.
steps.content: Click all the O's to destroy them. O's will begin to swarm the page and attack the search results. It takes about 3 clicks on each O to destroy it. Make sure to scroll down. The O's will come from all directions!

steps.title: Share the game (optional).
steps.content: Share the game (optional). The game will end when the O's have completely destroyed all the search results on the page. You'll see them form a "GG" (Good Game) in the center of the page. Currently, there's no way to win against the "Zergs", but you can see how many O's you destroyed in the Count box. To share the game: tap the + on the left to open all sharing options. Click an option to be redirected to the platform. There are other Google easter eggs you can find, such as Google gravity . You can also do a barrel roll !
